about_the_game:
Low wage. Exhaustion. Expensive fish and chips. Welcome to the United Kingdom.

DIGGERGUN is an oppressive life sim platformer about workers, minimum pay and the environment. You’re trapped on a blustery island, forced to work at Cornwall Mining Corp where it’s shadier than the game’s monochrome palette.

To escape, you need to earn £3000 from digging precious lithium. To survive, you need to manage your time, energy and money during the rigid day-and-night cycle.

Will you make ends meet while digging for freedom or find another way out and bring down the whole bloomin’ system?

Features:

  • An atmospheric world with fleshed-out characters; everyone you meet has their own distinct personality and storyline.
  • Multiple endings: who you interact with (or don’t) will change the outcome of your story.
  • Unique energy system where your actions truly matter as the game tracks your gameplay and punishes/rewards you for your choices.
  • Life sim where wages, food, rent, and much more are based on the current cost-of-living in the United Kingdom. There's even a tax system calculated to real-world rates!
  • Diverse range of randomly generated mines and intricately hand-designed levels to ensure you’re always kept on your toes.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 4-bit Ubuntu 14.04+
  • Processor: 2 GHz dual-core
  • Memory: 2 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Any AMD or nVidia graphics card with latest drivers
  • Storage: 300 MB available space

name: DIGGERGUN

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, 11 or newer
  • Processor: 2 GHz dual-core
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Any AMD or nVidia graphics card with latest drivers
  • Storage: 300 MB available space

short_description: DIGGERGUN is an atmospheric life-sim, platformer with a rich narrative featuring player choice and multiple endings. Tasked with mining lithium, you’ll need to earn £3,000 to leave Bal Island. Will you be able to save enough working your minimum wage job, or will you escape through other means?
